title: Who lived longest in a medical coma? - Quora

response.answer_text: On Aug. 6, 1941, 6-year-old Elaine Esposito went to the hospital for a routine appendectomy. She went under general anesthetic and never came out. Dubbed the "sleeping beauty," Esposito stayed in a coma for 37 years and 111 days before succumbing in 1978 — to the longest-ever coma, according to Guinness World Records.

Who lived longest in a medical coma? Edwarda O'Bara went into a diabetic coma in 1970, and stayed in that state until her death 42 years later. As for the longest coma from which someone has awoken, that honor belongs to Terry Wallis, who spent 19 years in a coma after an automobile accident.
